results.question: Match the term 'critical path' to its description:
results.correct_answer: e. the series of tasks whose scheduling directly affects the project’s finish date
incorrect_answers: a. the amount of time a task can be delayed before it will delay another task
b. a restriction that controls the start or finish date of a task
c. the condition of a resource when the total work of its task assignments is exactly equal to that resource’s work capacity

results.question: Match the term 'free slack' to its description:
results.correct_answer: d. the amount of time a task can be delayed without delaying the project completion date
incorrect_answers: a. the amount of time a task can be delayed before it will delay another task
b. a restriction that controls the start or finish date of a task
c. the condition of a resource when the total work of its task assignments is exactly equal to that resource’s work capacity

results.question: Match the term 'split' to its description:
results.correct_answer: g. an interruption in a task
incorrect_answers: a. the amount of time a task can be delayed before it will delay another task
b. a restriction that controls the start or finish date of a task
c. the condition of a resource when the total work of its task assignments is exactly equal to that resource’s work capacity

results.question: Match the term 'underallocated' to its description:
results.correct_answer: h. the condition of a resource when the work assigned to a resource is less than the resource’s maximum capacity
incorrect_answers: a. the amount of time a task can be delayed before it will delay another task
b. a restriction that controls the start or finish date of a task
c. the condition of a resource when the total work of its task assignments is exactly equal to that resource’s work capacity

results.question: Match the term 'recurring task' to its description:
results.correct_answer: i. a task that is repeated at specific intervals
incorrect_answers: a. the amount of time a task can be delayed before it will delay another task
b. a restriction that controls the start or finish date of a task
c. the condition of a resource when the total work of its task assignments is exactly equal to that resource’s work capacity

results.question: Match the term 'fixed units' to its description:
results.correct_answer: j. a task type in which the units value does not automatically change
incorrect_answers: a. the amount of time a task can be delayed before it will delay another task
b. a restriction that controls the start or finish date of a task
c. the condition of a resource when the total work of its task assignments is exactly equal to that resource’s work capacity

results.question: Match the term 'constraint' to its description:
results.correct_answer: f. a restriction that forces a task to begin or end on a certain date, preventing the rescheduling of a task
incorrect_answers: a. the amount of time a task can be delayed before it will delay another task
b. a restriction that controls the start or finish date of a task
c. the condition of a resource when the total work of its task assignments is exactly equal to that resource’s work capacity

results.question: Match the term 'fully allocated' to its description:
results.correct_answer: c. the condition of a resource when the total work of its task assignments is exactly equal to that resource’s work capacity
incorrect_answers: a. the amount of time a task can be delayed before it will delay another task
b. a restriction that controls the start or finish date of a task
h. the condition of a resource when the work assigned to a resource is less than the resource’s maximum capacity

results.question: Match the term 'inflexible constraint' to its description:
results.correct_answer: b. a restriction that controls the start or finish date of a task
incorrect_answers: a. the amount of time a task can be delayed before it will delay another task
f. a restriction that forces a task to begin or end on a certain date, preventing the rescheduling of a task
c. the condition of a resource when the total work of its task assignments is exactly equal to that resource’s work capacity

results.question: Match the term 'total slack' to its description:
results.correct_answer: a. the amount of time a task can be delayed before it will delay another task
incorrect_answers: i. a task that is repeated at specific intervals
b. a restriction that controls the start or finish date of a task
c. the condition of a resource when the total work of its task assignments is exactly equal to that resource’s work capacity

results.question: It is always best to enter a start or finish date for every task.
results.correct_answer: F
incorrect_answers: T

results.question: By default, critical path tasks are shown in red on the Detail Gantt view.
results.correct_answer: T
incorrect_answers: F

results.question: It is never acceptable to have an overallocated resource.
results.correct_answer: F
incorrect_answers: T

results.question: It is not possible to split a task over a weekend.
results.correct_answer: F
incorrect_answers: T

results.question: Effort-driven scheduling and task types both affect all resources in the same way.
results.correct_answer: T
incorrect_answers: F

results.question: You cannot change the task type for a summary task.
results.correct_answer: F
incorrect_answers: T

results.question: You can use a task calendar to schedule a task that will occur during working time that is not available on the project calendar.
results.correct_answer: T
incorrect_answers: F

results.question: It is acceptable to have a resource group named Unassigned.
results.correct_answer: T
incorrect_answers: F

results.question: It is not possible to set a specific time of day for a recurring task.
results.correct_answer: T
incorrect_answers: F

results.question: You can split a task only three times.
results.correct_answer: F
incorrect_answers: T
